subject: Philosophy
title: Can East and West Be Reconciled?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Can East and West Be Reconciled?.

hook.text: Western philosophy asks 'what is true?' Eastern philosophy asks 'how should I live?' Different starting points.

buildup.text: The West emphasizes logic, analysis, and individual rights. The East emphasizes harmony, intuition, and relationships.

discovery.text: But the divide is exaggerated. Aristotle's virtue ethics and Confucianism share deep similarities.

twist.text: Modern global culture already blends them. Mindfulness in therapy, human rights in Asia â€” the merging is underway.

climax.text: The best philosophy of the future might draw from both traditions without privileging either.

quiz.question: How does Western philosophy typically differ from Eastern?
options: West emphasizes logic and individual rights; East emphasizes harmony and relationships
